block.p: Re ''So, Do I Make the Cut?,'' April 29: Neither as renter nor homeowner have I ever come across a dog who: plays his music too loud; blocks my driveway; steals my parking space; lets his trash blow into the street; or leaves the building door ajar. In fact, in social and public settings, the average dog, I have found, is much better behaved than the average human. Want greater civility? Start with the people. The dogs are the least of our problems.

Life is so hard for these people and their pets. When most people in this world can't afford to live decently, the superrich are willing to pay an obscene amount of extra rent for a pet when, somewhere else in the world, that money could house and feed a family of six. I love my pet as much as the next guy, but really, the values in this city and the overall sickness of the real estate mind-set are very, very disturbing.
